```{r setup, include=FALSE}
# Set your working directory
getwd()
# Load your packages
library(tidyverse)
library(lubridate)
library(ggplot2)
library(raster)
library(here)
library(sf)
library(leaflet)
library(agricolae)
library(rvest)
library(vctrs)
library(mapview)

# Set your ggplot theme
mytheme<-theme_classic(base_size=13)+
theme(
legend.background = element_rect(color='grey',fill='beige'),
plot.title=element_text(color='black',size=15),
legend.position="right",
legend.text = element_text(size=11)
)

```

# Load your datasets
```{r}
#dataset on palm cultivation 
palm_production <-read.csv("./palm-oil-production.csv",stringsAsFactors = TRUE)
#filtering for only Indonesia and Malaysia 
palm_production_ts <- palm_production_ts %>%
  select(Entity, Year, Palm.oil...00000257....Production...005510....tonnes)%>%
  filter(Entity == "Indonesia"| Entity == "Malaysia")

#plotting over the years to see the trend 
options(scipen = 999)
palm_production_graph <- ggplot(palm_production_ts, aes(x=Year, y = Palm.oil...00000257....Production...005510....tonnes, color = Entity)) + 
  geom_point()+ 
  geom_smooth(method = lm)+ 
  labs(x= "Years", y = "Palm Oil Production (tonnes)", title = "Palm Production in Indonesia and Malaysia over the years")

#scientific notation on the y-axis needs to be checked 

#dataset on forest area 
forest_area_ind <- read.csv("./environment_idn.csv",stringsAsFactors = TRUE, skip = 1)
forest_area_ind <- forest_area_ind %>%
  filter(X.indicator.code == "AG.LND.FRST.K2") %>%
  select(X.country.name, X.date.year, X.indicator.value.num)

forest_area_ind$forest_area <- forest_area_ind$X.indicator.value.num 
forest_area_ind$X.indicator.value.num <- NULL

forest_area_mly <- read.csv("./environment_mys.csv", stringsAsFactors = TRUE, skip = 1)
forest_area_mly <- forest_area_mly %>%
  filter(X.indicator.code == "AG.LND.FRST.K2") %>%
  select(X.country.name, X.date.year, X.indicator.value.num)

forest_area_mly$forest_area <- forest_area_mly$X.indicator.value.num 
forest_area_mly$X.indicator.value.num <- NULL

forest_area <- rbind(forest_area_ind,forest_area_mly)

forest_area_graph <- ggplot(forest_area, aes(x=X.date.year, y = forest_area, color = X.country.name)) + 
  geom_point()+ 
  geom_smooth(method = lm)+ 
  labs(x= "Years", y = "Forest Area (sq. km)", title = "Forest Area over the years")

#datasets on carbon emissions 
carbon_emissions <- read.csv("./ghg-emissions-by-sector_indonesia.csv", stringsAsFactors = TRUE)
carbon_emissions <- carbon_emissions %>%
  filter(Entity == "Indonesia"| Entity == "Malaysia")%>%
  select(Entity, Year, Greenhouse.gas.emissions.from.land.use.change.and.forestry)

carbon_emissions_graph <- ggplot(carbon_emissions, aes(x=Year, y = Greenhouse.gas.emissions.from.land.use.change.and.forestry, color = Entity)) + 
  geom_point()+ 
  geom_smooth(method = lm)+ 
  labs(x= "Years", y = "Carbon Dioxide Emissions (billion tonnes)", title = "Carbon Dioxide Emissions over the years")
```

```{r}
#Data set on global prices 
global_price <-read.csv("./Global price of palm oil.csv",stringsAsFactors = TRUE)
global_price$DATE <- ymd(global_price$DATE)
global_price_graph <- ggplot(global_price, aes(x= DATE, y = PPOILUSDM))+
  geom_point()+
  geom_smooth(method = lm)+
   labs(x= "Years", y = "Global Price Levels", title = "Plam Oil Global Price Trends")
```
